CatDescriptText: Mr. L. G. Leonardo, downtown YMCA, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" Answer reads: "Never, because so many people go in for it to the extent that it is recognized in the courts and elsewhere."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of L. G. Leonardo, wearing flecked button down coat with collar and lapels, plaid button down collared shirt, and moustache, standing in front of brick wall
